page.title: 06HODNET'S PEAL OF 8 BELLS
page.content: Hodnet Church has 8 bells, which are placed in a sand-stone octagonal tower. The 6 heaviest bells date back to 1769. They were made by{Rudhalls. The 2 lightest bells were given by{Mr. {Heber_Percy's}aunty in memory of the men who died in the 2nd World War. These were made by{Taylors. The weight of the bells are:_ 1. 4cwt 2lbs, 2. 5cwt, 3. 5cwt 3lbs, 4. 6cwt, 5. 6cwt 3lbs, 6. 7cwt 3lbs, 7. 9cwt 2lbs, 8. 12cwt. Mr.Morris,the captain of the bell ringers, has been ringing the bells for 25 years and is the secretary and treasurer of the bells. His daughter, Mrs Mair Mothershaw, & his grand- daughter, Sarah Mothershaw also ring the bells. There are ten bellringers. Joe Capper,rang for 60 years,is the longest bellringer at Hodnet Church. Donna Woollacott age 11
